urn:contentItem:60P0-4RV1-DXKH-N2KN-00000-00August 24, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Janssen Gains Approval For Phase III Covid-19 Vaccine Trials In Brazil2020-08-26T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T21:16:36ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSAugust 24, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Janssen Gains Approval For Phase III Covid-19 Vaccine Trials In Brazil

The Latest: On August 18 2020, the Brazilian health regulatory approved human clinical trials for a Covid-19 vaccine candidate, Ad26.COV2.S, developed by Johnson & Johnson's (J&J)'s pharmaceutical subsidiary, Janssen. The randomised, controlled, double-blind, Phase III trial will involve 6,000 volunteers from Brazil and a total of 60,000 participants worldwide. The.

INDEX

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

Business Monitor International Inc.

Key Stats

Estimated Revenue (TTM): $1 Million

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

2.1 ACTIVITIES

Business Monitor International Inc. provides Country Risk and industry research analysis in the United States. The company was incorporated in 2009 and is based in New York, New York. Business Monitor International Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Business Monitor International Ltd.

2.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4296431365

Website: http://www.businessmonitor.com

Industry: Software and Technology Servic

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

June 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahamas Poor Fiscal Outlook To Constrain Healthcare Spending

We at Fitch Solutions see downside risks to Bahamas growth as the coronavirus pandemic may cause extended damage to the tourism industry. The government's healthcare budget will come under pressure in the near term, as the Bahamas recovers from Hurricane Dorian and the Covid-19 impact. The Bahamas could increasingly attract investment from active pharmaceutical ingr.

Source: Company Website

May 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Myanmar Emergency Tenders To Support Gas-Fired Power Growth

We have revised our Myanmar thermal capacity forecasts to account for the progress of several gas-fired projects under emergency tenders. While these projects have faced delays and missed their operational deadlines as we expected, progress will mean that they are likely to still come online within two years, by a conservative estimate.

Source: Company Website

April 03: Business Monitor International Inc.: Collaborations Aim To Eliminate Medical Device Shortages Caused By Covid-19

Due to the increasing prevalence of Covid-19 (coronavirus), the demand for ventilators, personal protective equipment and testing devices is likely to remain unmet in the short term. In order to meet the sudden demand for respiratory devices, large medical device companies such as GE healthcare are collaborating with both medical and non-medical manufacturers. The d.

Source: Company Website

March 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Big Tech After Covid-19: Cash And Regulation

We believe the Big Tech companies are in a strong position to expand post-coronavirus. There could be greater divergence between the US and the EU when it comes to tech regulation.

Source: Company Website

March 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Gym And Fitness Subscription A Trend To Watch In China, Despite Covid-19 Outbreak

A large youth population, expanding wealth and increasing health awareness are the demand drivers behind the gym and fitness-as-a-subscription services (yoga, spin, boxing) expansion in China. While this sector has struggled during the Covid-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, we believe that this will be a short term dampening to this trend, as the underlying fundamentals remain in place. We believe that international and domestic fitness service providers that continue to innovate, and continue to offer unique exercise experiences will be best placed to grow their offering and engage wit.

Source: Company Website

March 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa 4G Developments: Licences, Launches And Investment

Operators remain focused on deploying advanced mobile data services in Sub-Saharan Africa, but driving uptake and monetisation remain long-term plays. Facing highly competitive operating environments, players will focus on boosting their spectrum assets and ensuring superior network quality and reach as competitive differentiators.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Rising Saudi Tensions Pose Major Energy Supply Risk For Pakistan

Pakistan is set to become more dependent on foreign oil imports as repercussions from the Covid-19 pandemic add to its refining woes. The Covid-19 pandemic has collapsed what little was left of domestic refining activity in the country. Lockdowns imposed nationwide in April saw sales of major fuels plummet as economic activity and movement were curtailed. This forced domestic refiners to slash runs and brin.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Impact Of Covid-19 On Consumers In North Africa

We are forecasting that the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic and the subsequent movement restrictions will have a negative impact on consumer spending habits, with 2020 projected to record the strongest decline in real household spending in the Maghreb sub-region since we started tracking in 2000. We highlight three key inputs that drive our bleak 2020 consumer outlook: subdue.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Cuba's Domestic Medicine Market Will Continue To Flourish

Cuba's pharmaceutical trade balance will remain positive as the island's innovative medicines continue to generate interest across the world. Cuba has taken great strides toward the improvement of its pharmaceutical and healthcare sector. The country's recent focus on improving global trade relations will lead to improved access to Cuban medications.

Source: Company Website

August 24: Business Monitor International Inc.: Traction Of Green Hydrogen In Asia Led By Two Key Markets

We believe that the Asia Pacific region offers increasing growth opportunities for the green hydrogen sector over the coming years, due to the increasing viability of the technology and proliferation of cheap low-carbon electricity, such as renewables. Our view is also underpinned by increasing government support and rising investor interests in several key markets, driven pr.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Spanish Smoking Ban Poses Downside Risks To Tobacco And Restaurant Spending

As Spain battles with a significant increase in the number of Covid-19 cases, numerous autonomous communities across the country have implemented a ban on smoking in public areas in August 2020. This measure includes a ban on smoking in the street and in/around bars, cafes and restaurants, if a two-metre distance between people cannot be maintained. We highlight th.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Beirut Explosion And Surge In Covid-19 Cases Poses Risks To Medical Device Market In Lebanon

The aftermath of an explosion in Beirut, Lebanon will restrict medical device imports to the country. Following the crisis in Beirut, cases of Covid-19 are spiking and will exacerbate the strain on the healthcare system. Medical Device Industry Risks will remain high in Lebanon without increased healthcare expenditure and development of the market.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: South Korea Telecoms Outlook: 5G To Sustain Growth, Pay-TV Still A Key Focus

The three South Korean telecoms incumbents reported resilient operational and financial results in the first half of 2020, supporting our bullish view of South Korea's telecoms sector. 5G will remain the key priority for operator capex in the coming quarters, although we expect funds will be earmarked for acquisition of cable TV players, which will be complementary to the IPT.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Dengue Fever Cases Spike In Paraguay

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. Covid-19 has redirected healthcare funds away from other health issues. Although dengue is more prevalent, Covid-19 remains more fatal.

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), the country has reported 219,913.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Madagascar Telecoms On Positive Track, But Service Monetisation A Distant Prospect

Madagascan regulator data show that the mobile market has returned to growth, supporting 11.7mn subscribers for a penetration rate of 43.4%, meanwhile the wireline voice market posts a second year of growth, ending 2019 with 73,673 lines. Industry players are investing to extend the reach and capacity of their networks, with a focus on driving the uptake of advanced services and not just organic growth, but a significantly weakened consumer profile and increased taxation of communications services remain a key inhibitor of growth. Over the longer term, an improving economic outlook.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: Downside Risks To Forecasts As Mexican State Bans Junk Food And Sugar Drinks To Children

Further food and drink regulation is planned by the Mexican authorities, with the state of Oaxaca announcing on August 5 that it would ban the sale junk food and sugary beverages for children. This move comes as a front-of-package labelling law is due to implemented nationwide in October 2020. We believe Covid-19 and its high mortality rate associated with obesity w.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: OPEC Compliance Gains Stall For Iraq And Nigeria

Improving compliance from Iraq and Nigeria has stalled according to July OPEC data at 89% for Iraq and 66% for Nigeria though both stand greatly improved from the sub 50% compliance registered in May, the first month of pandemic related production cut of 9.7mn b/d. If the current OPEC+ agreement runs to its planned expiry in April 2022, it is unlikely that any of Iraq or Nige.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: Covid-19 Disrupting Alcoholic Drinks Trade In South Africa

Key View: We at Fitch Solutions have made a further downward revision to our 2020 alcoholic drinks consumption forecast for South Africa. Our forecast for alcoholic drinks consumption now drops to a contraction of -5.4% y-o-y for 2020, from a pre-Covid-19 forecast of 0.7% growth y-o-y. Initially, in March 2020, we made a downward revision to 0.5% growth, when the alcohol ban was first put in place. On J. Source: Company Website

August 14: Business Monitor International Inc.: Public Health Sector In Australia Under Strain

An ageing population and changing lifestyles will accelerate healthcare spending growth in the long term in Australia. Innovative drug sales in the country are expected to gradually expand throughout the forecast period, despite the effects of cost-containment policies. The private sector will play an increasingly important role in the future of healthcare provision.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

Simon Longfield, CFO

Terence Alexander, Chief Operating Officer

Jon Ewing, Chief Technology Officer & Chief Marketing Officer

Diane Milliard, Global Head of HR and Recruitment

Gregory Roth, Global Head-Communications

Lyndsey Anderson, Global Head-Research

urn:contentItem:60P0-4RV1-DXKH-N2KP-00000-00August 24, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Traction Of Green Hydrogen In Asia Led By Two Key Markets2020-08-26T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T21:16:36ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSAugust 24, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Traction Of Green Hydrogen In Asia Led By Two Key Markets

We believe that the Asia Pacific region offers increasing growth opportunities for the green hydrogen sector over the coming years, due to the increasing viability of the technology and proliferation of cheap low-carbon electricity, such as renewables. Our view is also underpinned by increasing government support and rising investor interests in several key markets, driven pr.

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

Business Monitor International Inc.

Key Stats

Estimated Revenue (TTM): $1 Million

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

2.1 ACTIVITIES

Business Monitor International Inc. provides Country Risk and industry research analysis in the United States. The company was incorporated in 2009 and is based in New York, New York. Business Monitor International Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Business Monitor International Ltd.

2.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4296431365

Website: http://www.businessmonitor.com

Industry: Software and Technology Servic

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

June 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahamas Poor Fiscal Outlook To Constrain Healthcare Spending

We at Fitch Solutions see downside risks to Bahamas growth as the coronavirus pandemic may cause extended damage to the tourism industry. The government's healthcare budget will come under pressure in the near term, as the Bahamas recovers from Hurricane Dorian and the Covid-19 impact. The Bahamas could increasingly attract investment from active pharmaceutical ingr.

Source: Company Website

May 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Myanmar Emergency Tenders To Support Gas-Fired Power Growth

We have revised our Myanmar thermal capacity forecasts to account for the progress of several gas-fired projects under emergency tenders. While these projects have faced delays and missed their operational deadlines as we expected, progress will mean that they are likely to still come online within two years, by a conservative estimate.

Source: Company Website

April 03: Business Monitor International Inc.: Collaborations Aim To Eliminate Medical Device Shortages Caused By Covid-19

Due to the increasing prevalence of Covid-19 (coronavirus), the demand for ventilators, personal protective equipment and testing devices is likely to remain unmet in the short term. In order to meet the sudden demand for respiratory devices, large medical device companies such as GE healthcare are collaborating with both medical and non-medical manufacturers. The d.

Source: Company Website

March 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Big Tech After Covid-19: Cash And Regulation

We believe the Big Tech companies are in a strong position to expand post-coronavirus. There could be greater divergence between the US and the EU when it comes to tech regulation.

Source: Company Website

March 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Gym And Fitness Subscription A Trend To Watch In China, Despite Covid-19 Outbreak

A large youth population, expanding wealth and increasing health awareness are the demand drivers behind the gym and fitness-as-a-subscription services (yoga, spin, boxing) expansion in China. While this sector has struggled during the Covid-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, we believe that this will be a short term dampening to this trend, as the underlying fundamentals remain in place. We believe that international and domestic fitness service providers that continue to innovate, and continue to offer unique exercise experiences will be best placed to grow their offering and engage wit.

Source: Company Website

March 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa 4G Developments: Licences, Launches And Investment

Operators remain focused on deploying advanced mobile data services in Sub-Saharan Africa, but driving uptake and monetisation remain long-term plays. Facing highly competitive operating environments, players will focus on boosting their spectrum assets and ensuring superior network quality and reach as competitive differentiators.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Rising Saudi Tensions Pose Major Energy Supply Risk For Pakistan

Pakistan is set to become more dependent on foreign oil imports as repercussions from the Covid-19 pandemic add to its refining woes. The Covid-19 pandemic has collapsed what little was left of domestic refining activity in the country. Lockdowns imposed nationwide in April saw sales of major fuels plummet as economic activity and movement were curtailed. This forced domestic refiners to slash runs and brin.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Impact Of Covid-19 On Consumers In North Africa

We are forecasting that the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic and the subsequent movement restrictions will have a negative impact on consumer spending habits, with 2020 projected to record the strongest decline in real household spending in the Maghreb sub-region since we started tracking in 2000. We highlight three key inputs that drive our bleak 2020 consumer outlook: subdue.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Cuba's Domestic Medicine Market Will Continue To Flourish

Cuba's pharmaceutical trade balance will remain positive as the island's innovative medicines continue to generate interest across the world. Cuba has taken great strides toward the improvement of its pharmaceutical and healthcare sector. The country's recent focus on improving global trade relations will lead to improved access to Cuban medications.

Source: Company Website

August 24: Business Monitor International Inc.: Janssen Gains Approval For Phase III Covid-19 Vaccine Trials In Brazil

The Latest: On August 18 2020, the Brazilian health regulatory approved human clinical trials for a Covid-19 vaccine candidate, Ad26.COV2.S, developed by Johnson & Johnson's (J&J)'s pharmaceutical subsidiary, Janssen. The randomised, controlled, double-blind, Phase III trial will involve 6,000 volunteers from Brazil and a total of 60,000 participants worldwide. The.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Spanish Smoking Ban Poses Downside Risks To Tobacco And Restaurant Spending

As Spain battles with a significant increase in the number of Covid-19 cases, numerous autonomous communities across the country have implemented a ban on smoking in public areas in August 2020. This measure includes a ban on smoking in the street and in/around bars, cafes and restaurants, if a two-metre distance between people cannot be maintained. We highlight th.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Beirut Explosion And Surge In Covid-19 Cases Poses Risks To Medical Device Market In Lebanon

The aftermath of an explosion in Beirut, Lebanon will restrict medical device imports to the country. Following the crisis in Beirut, cases of Covid-19 are spiking and will exacerbate the strain on the healthcare system. Medical Device Industry Risks will remain high in Lebanon without increased healthcare expenditure and development of the market.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: South Korea Telecoms Outlook: 5G To Sustain Growth, Pay-TV Still A Key Focus

The three South Korean telecoms incumbents reported resilient operational and financial results in the first half of 2020, supporting our bullish view of South Korea's telecoms sector. 5G will remain the key priority for operator capex in the coming quarters, although we expect funds will be earmarked for acquisition of cable TV players, which will be complementary to the IPT.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Dengue Fever Cases Spike In Paraguay

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. Covid-19 has redirected healthcare funds away from other health issues. Although dengue is more prevalent, Covid-19 remains more fatal.

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), the country has reported 219,913.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Madagascar Telecoms On Positive Track, But Service Monetisation A Distant Prospect

Madagascan regulator data show that the mobile market has returned to growth, supporting 11.7mn subscribers for a penetration rate of 43.4%, meanwhile the wireline voice market posts a second year of growth, ending 2019 with 73,673 lines. Industry players are investing to extend the reach and capacity of their networks, with a focus on driving the uptake of advanced services and not just organic growth, but a significantly weakened consumer profile and increased taxation of communications services remain a key inhibitor of growth. Over the longer term, an improving economic outlook.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: Downside Risks To Forecasts As Mexican State Bans Junk Food And Sugar Drinks To Children

Further food and drink regulation is planned by the Mexican authorities, with the state of Oaxaca announcing on August 5 that it would ban the sale junk food and sugary beverages for children. This move comes as a front-of-package labelling law is due to implemented nationwide in October 2020. We believe Covid-19 and its high mortality rate associated with obesity w.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: OPEC Compliance Gains Stall For Iraq And Nigeria

Improving compliance from Iraq and Nigeria has stalled according to July OPEC data at 89% for Iraq and 66% for Nigeria though both stand greatly improved from the sub 50% compliance registered in May, the first month of pandemic related production cut of 9.7mn b/d. If the current OPEC+ agreement runs to its planned expiry in April 2022, it is unlikely that any of Iraq or Nige.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: Covid-19 Disrupting Alcoholic Drinks Trade In South Africa

Key View: We at Fitch Solutions have made a further downward revision to our 2020 alcoholic drinks consumption forecast for South Africa. Our forecast for alcoholic drinks consumption now drops to a contraction of -5.4% y-o-y for 2020, from a pre-Covid-19 forecast of 0.7% growth y-o-y. Initially, in March 2020, we made a downward revision to 0.5% growth, when the alcohol ban was first put in place. On J. Source: Company Website

August 14: Business Monitor International Inc.: Public Health Sector In Australia Under Strain

An ageing population and changing lifestyles will accelerate healthcare spending growth in the long term in Australia. Innovative drug sales in the country are expected to gradually expand throughout the forecast period, despite the effects of cost-containment policies. The private sector will play an increasingly important role in the future of healthcare provision.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

Simon Longfield, CFO

Terence Alexander, Chief Operating Officer

Jon Ewing, Chief Technology Officer & Chief Marketing Officer

Diane Milliard, Global Head of HR and Recruitment

Gregory Roth, Global Head-Communications

Lyndsey Anderson, Global Head-Research

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Dengue Fever Cases Spike In Paraguay

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. Covid-19 has redirected healthcare funds away from other health issues. Although dengue is more prevalent, Covid-19 remains more fatal.

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), the country has reported 219,913.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Madagascar Telecoms On Positive Track, But Service Monetisation A Distant Prospect

Madagascan regulator data show that the mobile market has returned to growth, supporting 11.7mn subscribers for a penetration rate of 43.4%, meanwhile the wireline voice market posts a second year of growth, ending 2019 with 73,673 lines. Industry players are investing to extend the reach and capacity of their networks, with a focus on driving the uptake of advanced services and not just organic growth, but a significantly weakened consumer profile and increased taxation of communications services remain a key inhibitor of growth. Over the longer term, an improving economic outlook.

Source: Company Website

Further food and drink regulation is planned by the Mexican authorities, with the state of Oaxaca announcing on August 5 that it would ban the sale junk food and sugary beverages for children. This move comes as a front-of-package labelling law is due to implemented nationwide in October 2020. We believe Covid-19 and its high mortality rate associated with obesity w.

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: OPEC Compliance Gains Stall For Iraq And Nigeria

Improving compliance from Iraq and Nigeria has stalled according to July OPEC data at 89% for Iraq and 66% for Nigeria though both stand greatly improved from the sub 50% compliance registered in May, the first month of pandemic related production cut of 9.7mn b/d. If the current OPEC+ agreement runs to its planned expiry in April 2022, it is unlikely that any of Iraq or Nige.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: Covid-19 Disrupting Alcoholic Drinks Trade In South Africa

Key View: We at Fitch Solutions have made a further downward revision to our 2020 alcoholic drinks consumption forecast for South Africa. Our forecast for alcoholic drinks consumption now drops to a contraction of -5.4% y-o-y for 2020, from a pre-Covid-19 forecast of 0.7% growth y-o-y. Initially, in March 2020, we made a downward revision to 0.5% growth, when the alcohol ban was first put in place. On J. Source: Company Website

August 14: Business Monitor International Inc.: Public Health Sector In Australia Under Strain

An ageing population and changing lifestyles will accelerate healthcare spending growth in the long term in Australia. Innovative drug sales in the country are expected to gradually expand throughout the forecast period, despite the effects of cost-containment policies. The private sector will play an increasingly important role in the future of healthcare provision.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

We are forecasting that the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic and the subsequent movement restrictions will have a negative impact on consumer spending habits, with 2020 projected to record the strongest decline in real household spending in the Maghreb sub-region since we started tracking in 2000. We highlight three key inputs that drive our bleak 2020 consumer outlook: subdue.

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

Business Monitor International Inc.

Key Stats

Estimated Revenue (TTM): $1 Million

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

2.1 ACTIVITIES

Business Monitor International Inc. provides Country Risk and industry research analysis in the United States. The company was incorporated in 2009 and is based in New York, New York. Business Monitor International Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Business Monitor International Ltd.

2.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4296431365

Website: http://www.businessmonitor.com

Industry: Software and Technology Servic

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

June 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahamas Poor Fiscal Outlook To Constrain Healthcare Spending

We at Fitch Solutions see downside risks to Bahamas growth as the coronavirus pandemic may cause extended damage to the tourism industry. The government's healthcare budget will come under pressure in the near term, as the Bahamas recovers from Hurricane Dorian and the Covid-19 impact. The Bahamas could increasingly attract investment from active pharmaceutical ingr.

Source: Company Website

May 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Myanmar Emergency Tenders To Support Gas-Fired Power Growth

We have revised our Myanmar thermal capacity forecasts to account for the progress of several gas-fired projects under emergency tenders. While these projects have faced delays and missed their operational deadlines as we expected, progress will mean that they are likely to still come online within two years, by a conservative estimate.

Source: Company Website

April 03: Business Monitor International Inc.: Collaborations Aim To Eliminate Medical Device Shortages Caused By Covid-19

Due to the increasing prevalence of Covid-19 (coronavirus), the demand for ventilators, personal protective equipment and testing devices is likely to remain unmet in the short term. In order to meet the sudden demand for respiratory devices, large medical device companies such as GE healthcare are collaborating with both medical and non-medical manufacturers. The d.

Source: Company Website

March 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Big Tech After Covid-19: Cash And Regulation

We believe the Big Tech companies are in a strong position to expand post-coronavirus. There could be greater divergence between the US and the EU when it comes to tech regulation.

Source: Company Website

March 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Gym And Fitness Subscription A Trend To Watch In China, Despite Covid-19 Outbreak

A large youth population, expanding wealth and increasing health awareness are the demand drivers behind the gym and fitness-as-a-subscription services (yoga, spin, boxing) expansion in China. While this sector has struggled during the Covid-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, we believe that this will be a short term dampening to this trend, as the underlying fundamentals remain in place. We believe that international and domestic fitness service providers that continue to innovate, and continue to offer unique exercise experiences will be best placed to grow their offering and engage wit.

Source: Company Website

March 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa 4G Developments: Licences, Launches And Investment

Operators remain focused on deploying advanced mobile data services in Sub-Saharan Africa, but driving uptake and monetisation remain long-term plays. Facing highly competitive operating environments, players will focus on boosting their spectrum assets and ensuring superior network quality and reach as competitive differentiators.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Rising Saudi Tensions Pose Major Energy Supply Risk For Pakistan

Pakistan is set to become more dependent on foreign oil imports as repercussions from the Covid-19 pandemic add to its refining woes. The Covid-19 pandemic has collapsed what little was left of domestic refining activity in the country. Lockdowns imposed nationwide in April saw sales of major fuels plummet as economic activity and movement were curtailed. This forced domestic refiners to slash runs and brin.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Cuba's Domestic Medicine Market Will Continue To Flourish

Cuba's pharmaceutical trade balance will remain positive as the island's innovative medicines continue to generate interest across the world. Cuba has taken great strides toward the improvement of its pharmaceutical and healthcare sector. The country's recent focus on improving global trade relations will lead to improved access to Cuban medications.

Source: Company Website

August 24: Business Monitor International Inc.: Janssen Gains Approval For Phase III Covid-19 Vaccine Trials In Brazil

The Latest: On August 18 2020, the Brazilian health regulatory approved human clinical trials for a Covid-19 vaccine candidate, Ad26.COV2.S, developed by Johnson & Johnson's (J&J)'s pharmaceutical subsidiary, Janssen. The randomised, controlled, double-blind, Phase III trial will involve 6,000 volunteers from Brazil and a total of 60,000 participants worldwide. The.

Source: Company Website

August 24: Business Monitor International Inc.: Traction Of Green Hydrogen In Asia Led By Two Key Markets

We believe that the Asia Pacific region offers increasing growth opportunities for the green hydrogen sector over the coming years, due to the increasing viability of the technology and proliferation of cheap low-carbon electricity, such as renewables. Our view is also underpinned by increasing government support and rising investor interests in several key markets, driven pr.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Spanish Smoking Ban Poses Downside Risks To Tobacco And Restaurant Spending

As Spain battles with a significant increase in the number of Covid-19 cases, numerous autonomous communities across the country have implemented a ban on smoking in public areas in August 2020. This measure includes a ban on smoking in the street and in/around bars, cafes and restaurants, if a two-metre distance between people cannot be maintained. We highlight th.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Beirut Explosion And Surge In Covid-19 Cases Poses Risks To Medical Device Market In Lebanon

The aftermath of an explosion in Beirut, Lebanon will restrict medical device imports to the country. Following the crisis in Beirut, cases of Covid-19 are spiking and will exacerbate the strain on the healthcare system. Medical Device Industry Risks will remain high in Lebanon without increased healthcare expenditure and development of the market.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: South Korea Telecoms Outlook: 5G To Sustain Growth, Pay-TV Still A Key Focus

The three South Korean telecoms incumbents reported resilient operational and financial results in the first half of 2020, supporting our bullish view of South Korea's telecoms sector. 5G will remain the key priority for operator capex in the coming quarters, although we expect funds will be earmarked for acquisition of cable TV players, which will be complementary to the IPT.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:60P0-4RV1-DXKH-N2KK-00000-00August 25, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Rising Saudi Tensions Pose Major Energy Supply Risk For Pakistan2020-08-26T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T21:16:36ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSAugust 25, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Rising Saudi Tensions Pose Major Energy Supply Risk For Pakistan

Pakistan is set to become more dependent on foreign oil imports as repercussions from the Covid-19 pandemic add to its refining woes. The Covid-19 pandemic has collapsed what little was left of domestic refining activity in the country. Lockdowns imposed nationwide in April saw sales of major fuels plummet as economic activity and movement were curtailed. This forced domestic refiners to slash runs and brin.

INDEX

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

Business Monitor International Inc.

Key Stats

Estimated Revenue (TTM): $1 Million

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

2.1 ACTIVITIES

Business Monitor International Inc. provides Country Risk and industry research analysis in the United States. The company was incorporated in 2009 and is based in New York, New York. Business Monitor International Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Business Monitor International Ltd.

2.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4296431365

Website: http://www.businessmonitor.com

Industry: Software and Technology Servic

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

June 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahamas Poor Fiscal Outlook To Constrain Healthcare Spending

We at Fitch Solutions see downside risks to Bahamas growth as the coronavirus pandemic may cause extended damage to the tourism industry. The government's healthcare budget will come under pressure in the near term, as the Bahamas recovers from Hurricane Dorian and the Covid-19 impact. The Bahamas could increasingly attract investment from active pharmaceutical ingr.

Source: Company Website

May 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Myanmar Emergency Tenders To Support Gas-Fired Power Growth

We have revised our Myanmar thermal capacity forecasts to account for the progress of several gas-fired projects under emergency tenders. While these projects have faced delays and missed their operational deadlines as we expected, progress will mean that they are likely to still come online within two years, by a conservative estimate.

Source: Company Website

April 03: Business Monitor International Inc.: Collaborations Aim To Eliminate Medical Device Shortages Caused By Covid-19

Due to the increasing prevalence of Covid-19 (coronavirus), the demand for ventilators, personal protective equipment and testing devices is likely to remain unmet in the short term. In order to meet the sudden demand for respiratory devices, large medical device companies such as GE healthcare are collaborating with both medical and non-medical manufacturers. The d.

Source: Company Website

March 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Big Tech After Covid-19: Cash And Regulation

We believe the Big Tech companies are in a strong position to expand post-coronavirus. There could be greater divergence between the US and the EU when it comes to tech regulation.

Source: Company Website

March 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Gym And Fitness Subscription A Trend To Watch In China, Despite Covid-19 Outbreak

A large youth population, expanding wealth and increasing health awareness are the demand drivers behind the gym and fitness-as-a-subscription services (yoga, spin, boxing) expansion in China. While this sector has struggled during the Covid-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, we believe that this will be a short term dampening to this trend, as the underlying fundamentals remain in place. We believe that international and domestic fitness service providers that continue to innovate, and continue to offer unique exercise experiences will be best placed to grow their offering and engage wit.

Source: Company Website

March 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa 4G Developments: Licences, Launches And Investment

Operators remain focused on deploying advanced mobile data services in Sub-Saharan Africa, but driving uptake and monetisation remain long-term plays. Facing highly competitive operating environments, players will focus on boosting their spectrum assets and ensuring superior network quality and reach as competitive differentiators.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Impact Of Covid-19 On Consumers In North Africa

We are forecasting that the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic and the subsequent movement restrictions will have a negative impact on consumer spending habits, with 2020 projected to record the strongest decline in real household spending in the Maghreb sub-region since we started tracking in 2000. We highlight three key inputs that drive our bleak 2020 consumer outlook: subdue.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Cuba's Domestic Medicine Market Will Continue To Flourish

Cuba's pharmaceutical trade balance will remain positive as the island's innovative medicines continue to generate interest across the world. Cuba has taken great strides toward the improvement of its pharmaceutical and healthcare sector. The country's recent focus on improving global trade relations will lead to improved access to Cuban medications.

Source: Company Website

August 24: Business Monitor International Inc.: Janssen Gains Approval For Phase III Covid-19 Vaccine Trials In Brazil

The Latest: On August 18 2020, the Brazilian health regulatory approved human clinical trials for a Covid-19 vaccine candidate, Ad26.COV2.S, developed by Johnson & Johnson's (J&J)'s pharmaceutical subsidiary, Janssen. The randomised, controlled, double-blind, Phase III trial will involve 6,000 volunteers from Brazil and a total of 60,000 participants worldwide. The.

Source: Company Website

August 24: Business Monitor International Inc.: Traction Of Green Hydrogen In Asia Led By Two Key Markets

We believe that the Asia Pacific region offers increasing growth opportunities for the green hydrogen sector over the coming years, due to the increasing viability of the technology and proliferation of cheap low-carbon electricity, such as renewables. Our view is also underpinned by increasing government support and rising investor interests in several key markets, driven pr.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Spanish Smoking Ban Poses Downside Risks To Tobacco And Restaurant Spending

As Spain battles with a significant increase in the number of Covid-19 cases, numerous autonomous communities across the country have implemented a ban on smoking in public areas in August 2020. This measure includes a ban on smoking in the street and in/around bars, cafes and restaurants, if a two-metre distance between people cannot be maintained. We highlight th.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Beirut Explosion And Surge In Covid-19 Cases Poses Risks To Medical Device Market In Lebanon

The aftermath of an explosion in Beirut, Lebanon will restrict medical device imports to the country. Following the crisis in Beirut, cases of Covid-19 are spiking and will exacerbate the strain on the healthcare system. Medical Device Industry Risks will remain high in Lebanon without increased healthcare expenditure and development of the market.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: South Korea Telecoms Outlook: 5G To Sustain Growth, Pay-TV Still A Key Focus

The three South Korean telecoms incumbents reported resilient operational and financial results in the first half of 2020, supporting our bullish view of South Korea's telecoms sector. 5G will remain the key priority for operator capex in the coming quarters, although we expect funds will be earmarked for acquisition of cable TV players, which will be complementary to the IPT.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Dengue Fever Cases Spike In Paraguay

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. Covid-19 has redirected healthcare funds away from other health issues. Although dengue is more prevalent, Covid-19 remains more fatal.

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), the country has reported 219,913.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Madagascar Telecoms On Positive Track, But Service Monetisation A Distant Prospect

Madagascan regulator data show that the mobile market has returned to growth, supporting 11.7mn subscribers for a penetration rate of 43.4%, meanwhile the wireline voice market posts a second year of growth, ending 2019 with 73,673 lines. Industry players are investing to extend the reach and capacity of their networks, with a focus on driving the uptake of advanced services and not just organic growth, but a significantly weakened consumer profile and increased taxation of communications services remain a key inhibitor of growth. Over the longer term, an improving economic outlook.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: Downside Risks To Forecasts As Mexican State Bans Junk Food And Sugar Drinks To Children

Further food and drink regulation is planned by the Mexican authorities, with the state of Oaxaca announcing on August 5 that it would ban the sale junk food and sugary beverages for children. This move comes as a front-of-package labelling law is due to implemented nationwide in October 2020. We believe Covid-19 and its high mortality rate associated with obesity w.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: OPEC Compliance Gains Stall For Iraq And Nigeria

Improving compliance from Iraq and Nigeria has stalled according to July OPEC data at 89% for Iraq and 66% for Nigeria though both stand greatly improved from the sub 50% compliance registered in May, the first month of pandemic related production cut of 9.7mn b/d. If the current OPEC+ agreement runs to its planned expiry in April 2022, it is unlikely that any of Iraq or Nige.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Business Monitor International Inc.: Covid-19 Disrupting Alcoholic Drinks Trade In South Africa

Key View: We at Fitch Solutions have made a further downward revision to our 2020 alcoholic drinks consumption forecast for South Africa. Our forecast for alcoholic drinks consumption now drops to a contraction of -5.4% y-o-y for 2020, from a pre-Covid-19 forecast of 0.7% growth y-o-y. Initially, in March 2020, we made a downward revision to 0.5% growth, when the alcohol ban was first put in place. On J. Source: Company Website

August 14: Business Monitor International Inc.: Public Health Sector In Australia Under Strain

An ageing population and changing lifestyles will accelerate healthcare spending growth in the long term in Australia. Innovative drug sales in the country are expected to gradually expand throughout the forecast period, despite the effects of cost-containment policies. The private sector will play an increasingly important role in the future of healthcare provision.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

Simon Longfield, CFO

Terence Alexander, Chief Operating Officer

Jon Ewing, Chief Technology Officer & Chief Marketing Officer

Diane Milliard, Global Head of HR and Recruitment

Gregory Roth, Global Head-Communications

Lyndsey Anderson, Global Head-Research

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. urn:contentItem:60PF-7141-JB4F-Y0H1-00000-00August 27, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Continued Momentum In Dominican Republic Renewables Sector2020-08-28T00:00:00Z2020-10-05T21:16:36ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSAugust 27, 2020: Business Monitor International Inc.: Continued Momentum In Dominican Republic Renewables Sector

The Dominican Republic's non-hydro renewables sector continues to present signals for strong growth over the coming decade, primarily in the solar and wind power sectors. Our view is informed by the country's growing wind and solar project pipelines, as well as a favourable net metering scheme and continued government efforts to increase the share of renewables in the country.

INDEX

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 1 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. FINANCIALS

Business Monitor International Inc.

Key Stats

Estimated Revenue (TTM): $1 Million

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE

2.1 ACTIVITIES

Business Monitor International Inc. provides Country Risk and industry research analysis in the United States. The company was incorporated in 2009 and is based in New York, New York. Business Monitor International Inc. operates as a subsidiary of Business Monitor International Ltd.

2.2 SUMMARY

PermID: 4296431365

Website: http://www.businessmonitor.com

Industry: Software and Technology Servic

SECTION 3 PRESS RELEASES: 2020

June 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Bahamas Poor Fiscal Outlook To Constrain Healthcare Spending

We at Fitch Solutions see downside risks to Bahamas growth as the coronavirus pandemic may cause extended damage to the tourism industry. The government's healthcare budget will come under pressure in the near term, as the Bahamas recovers from Hurricane Dorian and the Covid-19 impact. The Bahamas could increasingly attract investment from active pharmaceutical ingr.

Source: Company Website

May 13: Business Monitor International Inc.: Myanmar Emergency Tenders To Support Gas-Fired Power Growth

We have revised our Myanmar thermal capacity forecasts to account for the progress of several gas-fired projects under emergency tenders. While these projects have faced delays and missed their operational deadlines as we expected, progress will mean that they are likely to still come online within two years, by a conservative estimate.

Source: Company Website

April 03: Business Monitor International Inc.: Collaborations Aim To Eliminate Medical Device Shortages Caused By Covid-19

Due to the increasing prevalence of Covid-19 (coronavirus), the demand for ventilators, personal protective equipment and testing devices is likely to remain unmet in the short term. In order to meet the sudden demand for respiratory devices, large medical device companies such as GE healthcare are collaborating with both medical and non-medical manufacturers. The d.

Source: Company Website

March 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Big Tech After Covid-19: Cash And Regulation

We believe the Big Tech companies are in a strong position to expand post-coronavirus. There could be greater divergence between the US and the EU when it comes to tech regulation.

Source: Company Website

March 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Gym And Fitness Subscription A Trend To Watch In China, Despite Covid-19 Outbreak

A large youth population, expanding wealth and increasing health awareness are the demand drivers behind the gym and fitness-as-a-subscription services (yoga, spin, boxing) expansion in China. While this sector has struggled during the Covid-19 (coronavirus) outbreak, we believe that this will be a short term dampening to this trend, as the underlying fundamentals remain in place. We believe that international and domestic fitness service providers that continue to innovate, and continue to offer unique exercise experiences will be best placed to grow their offering and engage wit.

Source: Company Website

March 04: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa 4G Developments: Licences, Launches And Investment

Operators remain focused on deploying advanced mobile data services in Sub-Saharan Africa, but driving uptake and monetisation remain long-term plays. Facing highly competitive operating environments, players will focus on boosting their spectrum assets and ensuring superior network quality and reach as competitive differentiators.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 4 OTHER NEWS: 2020

August 27: Business Monitor International Inc.: Sub-Saharan Africa Telecoms: Submarine Cable Developments

We anticipate higher Sub-Saharan African international bandwidth demand throughout our forecast period to 2029, driven by changing data consumption trends at consumer level and a digitising enterprise base. Increased capacity, speeds and lower connectivity costs will be boosted by investments from pure-play infrastructure providers, partnerships with telecommunications servic.

Source: Company Website

August 27: Business Monitor International Inc.: Singapore Pharmaceutical Exports To Benefit From Covid-19-Related Medicine Stockpiling

The pharmaceutical industry is an increasingly important component of Singapore's manufacturing sector. Pharmaceutical exports are a bright spot for Singapore's economy, as the Covid-19 pandemic drives demand. Development of innovative pharmaceuticals is a long-term ambition of the government of Singapore.

Source: Company Website

August 26: Business Monitor International Inc.: Landmark IPP Licences Point To Growth Potential In Botswana Power Sector

The landmark approval of three licenses for IPPs to either sell electricity into the grid or export it privately poses a significant upside risk to our bearish outlook on Botswana's power sector growth over our forecast period to 2029. We await the conclusion of long-term PPAs between the IPPs and the BPC, and the start of construction on these projects before factoring them.

Source: Company Website

August 26: Business Monitor International Inc.: Covid-19 Increases Digital Health Uptake In Ghana

Increased focus on social distancing due to Covid-19 has accelerated the uptake of digital health in Ghana Digital health challenges in Ghana remain. Ghana's eHealth strategy will continue working on making healthcare more equitable.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Rising Saudi Tensions Pose Major Energy Supply Risk For Pakistan

Pakistan is set to become more dependent on foreign oil imports as repercussions from the Covid-19 pandemic add to its refining woes. The Covid-19 pandemic has collapsed what little was left of domestic refining activity in the country. Lockdowns imposed nationwide in April saw sales of major fuels plummet as economic activity and movement were curtailed. This forced domestic refiners to slash runs and brin.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Cuba's Domestic Medicine Market Will Continue To Flourish

Cuba's pharmaceutical trade balance will remain positive as the island's innovative medicines continue to generate interest across the world. Cuba has taken great strides toward the improvement of its pharmaceutical and healthcare sector. The country's recent focus on improving global trade relations will lead to improved access to Cuban medications.

Source: Company Website

August 25: Business Monitor International Inc.: Impact Of Covid-19 On Consumers In North Africa

We are forecasting that the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic and the subsequent movement restrictions will have a negative impact on consumer spending habits, with 2020 projected to record the strongest decline in real household spending in the Maghreb sub-region since we started tracking in 2000. We highlight three key inputs that drive our bleak 2020 consumer outlook: subdue.

Source: Company Website

August 24: Business Monitor International Inc.: Janssen Gains Approval For Phase III Covid-19 Vaccine Trials In Brazil

The Latest: On August 18 2020, the Brazilian health regulatory approved human clinical trials for a Covid-19 vaccine candidate, Ad26.COV2.S, developed by Johnson & Johnson's (J&J)'s pharmaceutical subsidiary, Janssen. The randomised, controlled, double-blind, Phase III trial will involve 6,000 volunteers from Brazil and a total of 60,000 participants worldwide. The.

Source: Company Website

August 24: Business Monitor International Inc.: Traction Of Green Hydrogen In Asia Led By Two Key Markets

We believe that the Asia Pacific region offers increasing growth opportunities for the green hydrogen sector over the coming years, due to the increasing viability of the technology and proliferation of cheap low-carbon electricity, such as renewables. Our view is also underpinned by increasing government support and rising investor interests in several key markets, driven pr.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Spanish Smoking Ban Poses Downside Risks To Tobacco And Restaurant Spending

As Spain battles with a significant increase in the number of Covid-19 cases, numerous autonomous communities across the country have implemented a ban on smoking in public areas in August 2020. This measure includes a ban on smoking in the street and in/around bars, cafes and restaurants, if a two-metre distance between people cannot be maintained. We highlight th.

Source: Company Website

August 21: Business Monitor International Inc.: Beirut Explosion And Surge In Covid-19 Cases Poses Risks To Medical Device Market In Lebanon

The aftermath of an explosion in Beirut, Lebanon will restrict medical device imports to the country. Following the crisis in Beirut, cases of Covid-19 are spiking and will exacerbate the strain on the healthcare system. Medical Device Industry Risks will remain high in Lebanon without increased healthcare expenditure and development of the market.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: South Korea Telecoms Outlook: 5G To Sustain Growth, Pay-TV Still A Key Focus

The three South Korean telecoms incumbents reported resilient operational and financial results in the first half of 2020, supporting our bullish view of South Korea's telecoms sector. 5G will remain the key priority for operator capex in the coming quarters, although we expect funds will be earmarked for acquisition of cable TV players, which will be complementary to the IPT.

Source: Company Website

August 20: Business Monitor International Inc.: Dengue Fever Cases Spike In Paraguay

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. Covid-19 has redirected healthcare funds away from other health issues. Although dengue is more prevalent, Covid-19 remains more fatal.

Paraguay continues to see a rise in dengue fever cases. According to the Pan American Health Organization (PAHO), the country has reported 219,913.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

August 19: Business Monitor International Inc.: Romania Consumer Outlook: 2020 Covid-19 Impact Assessment And 2021 Recovery Scenario

Key View: Relaxation of lockdowns and movement restrictions, travel recommencing, non-essential retail and hospitality re-opening and the launch of government stimulus packages, are all being taken into account in our forecasts for the Romania consumer spending outlook in the short-to-medium term (2020-2024). The spread of Covid-19 globally will have a negative impact on Romania's consumer spending in 2020, with real household spending forecast to contract by -9.0% y-o-y. In 2021 we project real household spending to begin to recover, growing by a forecast 4.1% y-o-y.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 5 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. TOP MANAGEMENT

Richard Hall, CEO

Richard was appointed in June 2014 following the acquisition of Business Monitor International (now BMI Research) by the Fitch Group. Under his leadership BMI Research is poised for a new period of global growth which will benefit clients and contribute to Fitch's preeminence in financial and business information services. Before joining BMI, Richard spent eight years as COO at Mergermarket Limited where he created and launched Debtwire and dealReporter prior to its sale to Pearson Plc and earnout period. More recently, he was COO of WorldOne Limited where he played a key role in transforming the company from an entrepreneurial business to one poised for future growth. He is currently Non-executive Chairman of Cognolink Limited. Richard has an MA in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an MBA from INSEAD.

Simon Longfield, CFO

Terence Alexander, Chief Operating Officer

Jon Ewing, Chief Technology Officer & Chief Marketing Officer

Diane Milliard, Global Head of HR and Recruitment

Gregory Roth, Global Head-Communications

Lyndsey Anderson, Global Head-Research

The pharmaceutical industry is an increasingly important component of Singapore's manufacturing sector. Pharmaceutical exports are a bright spot for Singapore's economy, as the Covid-19 pandemic drives demand. Development of innovative pharmaceuticals is a long-term ambition of the government of Singapore.

INDEX

SECTION 2 BUSINESS MONITOR INTERNATIONAL INC. PROFILE
